article.title: Microscopic description of Log and Coulomb gases

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 depicts what phenomenon observed in superconductors with applied magnetic fields?
choices: Abrikosov lattice, a pattern formed by quantized vortices
Electron tunneling through a potential barrier

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 displays simulations of Log2 cases with varying β. What difference in behavior can be observed between high β (left) and low β (right)?
choices: High β shows a crystalline structure while low β appears disordered.
High β appears disordered while low β shows a crystalline structure.
Both high and low β show a similar, ordered structure.
Both high and low β appear equally disordered.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 represents what concept within the context of analyzing Coulomb gases at the microscopic scale?
choices: Electric field lines emanating from point charges.
Simulation of electron movement in a conductor.
Blown-up configuration representing point charges and neutralizing background density.
Visualization of a random matrix spectrum.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula 3.2 depicts the splitting formula for the Hamiltonian of a Coulomb gas system. What does the term FμVN(XN) represent?
choices: The leading order energy of the system
The contribution of the confining potential
The next-order energy term capturing charge fluctuations
The energy associated with the equilibrium measure
